text: In the present study , the role of IL-2R signaling in the growth of CD8+ T cell prolymphocytic leukemia ( T-PLL ) cells has been investigated .

Flow cytometry revealed that primary leukemia cells from a patient with CD8+ T-PLL expressed <extra_id_0> IL-2Ralpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> chains , and the cells showed a proliferative response and an increase in <extra_id_0> IL-2Ralpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression on culture with exogeneous <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Northern blot analysis failed to detect <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA , suggesting that <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may act in a paracrine manner in vivo .

Electrophoretic mobility-shift assays revealed that recombinant <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> increased NF-kappaB binding activity in nuclear extracts of the leukemia cells , and Northern blot analysis showed that <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> increased the abundance of mRNAs encoding the NF-kappaB components <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> KBF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in these cells .

text: <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding analysis demonstrated that <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> markedly increased the number of low affinity IL-2Rs on the leukemia cells , without an effect on the number of high - affinity IL-2Rs .

These results show that <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is capable of inducing the nuclear expression of NF-kappaB in primary CD8+ T-PLL cells , and that this effect is mediated , at least in part , at a pretranslational level .
